revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Google |model=Chromecast |revision=(H2G2-42) |upc=811571013579 |ean= |asin=B00DR0PDNE |price= |est_release_date=08/07/2013 |fcc_date=05/17/2013 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Flextronics |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=common |type=media streamer, computer-on-a-stick |fcc_id=A4RH2G2-42 |ic_id=10395A-H2G242 |us_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=0.85 |pwr_conn=USB Female Micro-B |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88DE3005;88DE3005-A1; |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=2 GiB |fla1_brand=Micron |fla1_model=MT29F16G08CBACA |ram1=512 |ram1_brand=Micron |ram1_model=MT41K256M16HA-125:E |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=AzureWave AW-NH387 |wi1_module_if=SDIO (module) |wi1_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip1_model=88W8787 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_none=true |addl_chips= |flags=HDMI out |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=ChromecastXXXX |default_ssid_regex=^Chromecast[0-9]{4}$ |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=D0:E7:82, F8:8F:CA }} :[https://play.google.com/store/devices/details?id=chromecast Product page]
{{WPLink|Chromecast}}
:See also FCC ID: {{FCC.io|A4RH2G2-2A}} (new revision?)
Before configuration, the device broadcasts an SSID w/ a format of ''ChromecastXXXX'' :(''XXXX'' being a 4-digit number) w/ a F8:8F:CA (''Google Fiber'') OUI. :After setup, the device seems to use a D0:E7:82 ([[AzureWave]]) OUI.
Per the FCC test report... *the manufacturer is noted as ''Flextronics International LTD'' *the product name is noted as ''H840 DEVICE'' *the device is single-stream 802.11b/g/n capable :[[AzureWave]] ''AW-NH387L'' (QFN) 1T1R 802.11bgn [http://www.azurewave.com/product_AW-NH387_1.asp PPage] :Inverted F Antenna (IFA) (1.9dBi gain) on the PCB *the device takes power via a standard USB Female Micro-B port.
The power adapter is specified as a... *'''GPN''' SSW-2222US (120-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz -> 5VDC) :[http://4pda.ru/forum/index.php?showtopic=262096&st=5340 this charger appears to have been used with ''Motorola'' phones] :([http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=2076590 photos on xda-developers.com's forums]) :100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.2A -> 5.1VDC 850mA, w/ USB (Female A) connector :[http://www.raspberrypi.org/phpBB3/viewtopic.php?t=39371&p=324974 standard USB charger w/ 850mA power output]
===Additional specifications=== Additional specifications, per '''Google''''s product page, follow... *Dimensions (L x W x H): [[Dimensions::72 mm x 35 mm x 12 mm]] *Weight: [[Weight::34 g]]
===Reviews=== *[http://www.anandtech.com/show/7186/google-chromecast-review-an-awesome-35-hdmi-dongle On '''AnandTech'''] <!-- nice [https://www.tindie.com/products/FriedCircuits/usb-tester-oled-backpack-bundle/ USB power consumption meter] --> *[http://www.flatpanelshd.com/review.php?subaction=showfull&id=1376286082 On '''FlatpanelsHD''']
===Wikis=== *[http://wiki.gtvhacker.com/index.php/Google_Chromecast On the '''GTVHacker Wiki''']
===External links=== *[http://www.ifixit.com/Teardown/Chromecast+Teardown/16069/1 Teardown on '''iFixit'''] :"H840 REV 3.30" is silkscreened on the board. :[[Marvell]] 88DE3005 (DE3005-A1, [https://origin-www.marvell.com/digital-entertainment/armada-1500-mini/index.jsp ''ARMADA'' 1500-mini]) SoC :''Micron'' MT29F16G08CBACA 16Gb (2GB) NAND :''Micron'' MT41K256M16HA-125:E 4Gb (512MB) DDR3 RAM (FBGA code D9PXV) :USB Female Micro-B power connector *[http://chromecastdev.com/ccdev/viewtopic.php?f=15&t=7 Thread w/ HW details on '''Chromecastdev.com'''] (FCC photos mirrored) :"H840 REV 3.10" appears to be silkscreened on the board. :[[Marvell]] 88DE3005-A1 (DE3005-A1) SoC :[https://origin-www.marvell.com/digital-entertainment/assets/armada_1000_pb.pdf Product brief for the DE3010] :''ARMADA'' 1000, dual Sheeva cores, [http://blog.gtvhacker.com/2013/chromecast-exploiting-the-newest-device-by-google/ the DE3005 uses a single core] :''Micron'' MT29F16G08CBACA 16Gb (2GB) NAND :''Micron'' MT41K256M16HA-125:E 4Gb (512MB) DDR3 RAM (FBGA code D9PXV) :Seems to have been code named ''Eureka''
__NOTOC__
